cards.originalText:

cards.name: Spike Weaver

Spike Weaver enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it.
{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

rulings.text: The second ability includes your own creatures as well.

{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
{1}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Weaver: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.text: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

{2}, Remove a +1/+1 counter from Spike Colony: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.

cards.name: Argothian Elder
cards.text: {T}: Untap two target lands.
cards.flavor:
Sharpen your ears
—Elvish expression meaning
"grow wiser"

rulings.text: The ability can target an already untapped land.
The ability must target two different lands. It can't be activated if there is just one land to target.

cards.originalText: {T}: Untap two target lands.

cards.name: Seasoned Marshal
cards.text: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.
cards.flavor: There are only two rules of tactics: never be without a plan, and never rely on it.

rulings.text: Can target an already tapped creature if you want.

cards.originalText: Whenever Seasoned Marshal attacks, you may tap target creature.

cards.name: Sanctum Custodian
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Serra told them to guard Urza as he healed. Five years they stood.
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Sanctum Guardian
cards.text: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: "Protect our mother in her womb."
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Sanctum Guardian: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature or player this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Advance Scout
cards.text:
First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The soldier's path is worn smooth by the tread of many feet—all in one direction, none returning."
—Oracle en-Vec
cards.originalText:
First strike
{W}: Target creature gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Soltari Foot Soldier
cards.text: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor:
"Children of the Ruins, raised to be warriors, know that life begins when another speaks their names."
—Soltari Tales of Life
cards.originalText: Shadow (This creature can block or be blocked by only creatures with shadow.)

cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice Elvish Lyrist: Destroy target enchantment.

cards.name: Sun Clasp
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"And darkness shall be cast from me
For my soul resides in the Sun."
—Femeref dirge
cards.originalText:
Enchanted creature gets +1/+3.
{W}: Return enchanted creature to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature can't attack or block.

cards.name: Fecundity
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, that creature's controller may draw a card.
cards.flavor: Life is eternal. A lifetime is ephemeral.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature is put into a graveyard from play, that creature's controller may draw a card.

cards.name: Sandstorm
cards.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
cards.flavor: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.
cards.originalText: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hurricane
cards.text: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

rulings.text: Whether or not a creature has flying is only checked on resolution.

cards.originalText: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

cards.name: Dirtcowl Wurm
cards.text: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.
cards.flavor: Few of Rath's rivers follow a steady course, so many new channels are carved for them.

rulings.text: A spell or ability that tells a player to "put a land onto the battlefield" does not count as playing a land.

cards.originalText: Whenever an opponent plays a land, put a +1/+1 counter on Dirtcowl Wurm.

cards.name: Land Tax
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can fetch any of the "Snow-Covered" lands, since they all also have the supertype basic.

This ability has an "intervening 'if' clause." That means (1) the ability won't trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don't put any basic land cards into your hand.

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, then put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.flavor:

—General Takeno

cards.flavor: "Crease the folds, bend the paper, turn the spirits, shield the soul."

cards.name: Faithful Squire
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Faithful Squire.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Faithful Squire, you may flip it.
cards.originalText:

cards.name: Final Judgment
cards.text: Exile all creatures.
cards.flavor:
"The clashing warriors turned to face O-Kagachi, the greatest kami, and their sigh of awe was their last breath."
—Great Battles of Kamigawa
cards.originalText: Remove all creatures from the game.

cards.name: Genju of the Fields
cards.text:
Enchant Plains
{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Plains becomes a 2/5 white Spirit creature with "Whenever this creature deals damage, its controller gains that much life." It's still a land.
When enchanted Plains is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fields from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: When activated multiple times, it will have the triggered ability multiple times. When the animated Plains deals damage, the ability will trigger once for each copy of the ability. If, for example, you activate the ability three times, the Plains will deal two damage, and you'll gain six life.

A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
{2}: Until end of turn, enchanted Plains becomes a 2/5 white Spirit creature with "Whenever this creature deals damage, you gain that much life." It's still a land.
When enchanted Plains is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Fields from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Heart of Light
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"There is a shining in the mortal heart that even the kami cannot reach."
—Sensei Golden-Tail
cards.originalText: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.name: Hokori, Dust Drinker
cards.text:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land they control.

rulings.text: If there are two Hokori on the battlefield (for example, if Mirror Gallery is on the battlefield), each player untaps two lands they control at the beginning of their upkeep.

foreignNames.name: 塵を飲み込むもの、放粉痢

cards.originalText:
Lands don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps a land he or she controls.

cards.name: Hundred-Talon Strike
cards.text:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (As you cast an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

rulings.text: You reveal all cards you intend to splice at the same time. Each individual card can be spliced only once onto any one spell.
A card with a splice ability can't be spliced onto itself because the spell is on the stack (and not in your hand) when you reveal the cards you want to splice onto it.

You choose all targets for the spell after revealing cards you want to splice, including any targets required by the text of any of those cards. You may choose a different target for each instance of the word "target" on the resulting spell.
If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
Splice onto Arcane—Tap an untapped white creature you control. (As you play an Arcane spell, you may reveal this card from your hand and pay its splice cost. If you do, add this card's effects to that spell.)

cards.name: Indebted Samurai
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a Samurai you control dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Indebted Samurai.
cards.flavor: "Forgive me, Saburo. I could not save you. But your blade will not rest in my hand."
cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
Whenever a Samurai you control is put into a graveyard from play, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Indebted Samurai.

cards.name: Kami of False Hope
cards.text: Sacrifice Kami of False Hope: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Across the rift of battle, a bridge of gossamer. And for one moment, it holds."
—Snow-Fur, kitsune poet
cards.originalText: Sacrifice Kami of False Hope: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Kami of Tattered Shoji
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of Tattered Shoji gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It remembered all the shadows lantern-cast upon its paper wings, and sometimes those silhouettes played across its shape again, acting out silent tragedies.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, Kami of Tattered Shoji gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Kami of the Honored Dead
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Kami of the Honored Dead is dealt damage, you gain that much life.
Soulshift 6 (When this creature dies, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Kami of the Honored Dead is dealt damage, you gain that much life.
Soulshift 6 (When this is put into a graveyard from play, you may return target Spirit card with converted mana cost 6 or less from your graveyard to your hand.)

cards.name: Kentaro, the Smiling Cat
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
You may pay {X} rather than pay the mana cost for Samurai spells you cast, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "The bonds of bushido will draw the dishonored back someday, and I will be there waiting."

rulings.text: Kentaro doesn't change when you can cast Samurai. It just makes Samurai castable for generic mana.
Kentaro's ability only applies while Kentaro is on the battlefield. You have to pay for Kentaro normally. It still costs {1}{W}.

cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
You may pay {X} rather than pay the mana cost for Samurai spells you play, where X is that spell's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Kitsune Palliator
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to each creature and each player this turn.
cards.flavor: "Who am I to judge who is deserving and who is not? That is a question for lords, not healers."

rulings.text: Kitsune Palliator's ability creates prevention shields for every creature and player when it resolves. It doesn't affect creatures that enter the battlefield (or become creatures) later.

cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to each creature and each player this turn.

cards.name: Mending Hands
cards.text: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor:
"I can staunch their blood, mend their flesh, and knit their bones. But I cannot restore their hope."
—Tender-Hand, kitsune healer
cards.originalText: Prevent the next 4 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.text:
Flying
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, create a 3/3 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: Her angry call split the sky. From that rift descended her champions.

foreignNames.name: Oyobi, celle qui fend les cieux
Oyobi, A que Rompeu o Céu
Oyobi, la que parte los cielos

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, put a 3/3 white Spirit creature token with flying into play.

cards.name: Patron of the Kitsune
cards.text:
Fox offering (You may cast this card any time you could cast an instant by sacrificing a Fox and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Fox. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever a creature attacks, you may gain 1 life.

rulings.text: You may gain one life per attacking creature when the ability resolves during each declare attackers step.
You may gain life when any creatures are declared as attackers, not just for attacking creatures you control.

cards.originalText:
Fox offering (You may play this card any time you could play an instant by sacrificing a Fox and paying the difference in mana costs between this and the sacrificed Fox. Mana cost includes color.)
Whenever a creature attacks, you may gain 1 life.

cards.name: Scour
cards.text: Exile target enchantment. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that enchantment and exile them. Then that player shuffles their library.

rulings.text: Does not exile other cards of the same name that are on the battlefield. Just from the graveyard, hand, and library.

Scour can target and exile cards that aren't always enchantments, but are enchantments when Scour is cast and resolves (such as creatures turned into enchantments by Soul Sculptor). Scour's exile effect only looks for cards by name, not type.
The copies must be found if they are in publicly viewable zones. Finding copies while searching private zones is optional.

cards.originalText: Remove target enchantment from the game. Search its controller's graveyard, hand, and library for all cards with the same name as that enchantment and remove them from the game. That player then shuffles his or her library.

cards.name: Shining Shoal
cards.text:
You may exile a white card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
The next X damage that a source of your choice would deal to you and/or creatures you control this turn is dealt to any target instead.

rulings.text: If the player or creature that was targeted is no longer playing or on the battlefield when the damage would occur, the damage isn't redirected.

The redirection protects both you and your creatures from the source. If the source would deal more than X damage to multiple objects, you decide which damage is redirected until X is used up. For example, your opponent casts a spell that deals 1 damage to you and 1 damage to two of your creatures. If you cast Shining Shoal with X = 2, you can have damage to you and one creature redirected to the target, or you could have damage to both creatures redirected.

cards.originalText:
You may remove a white card with converted mana cost X in your hand from the game rather than pay Shining Shoal's mana cost.
The next X damage that a source of your choice would deal to you or a creature you control this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.

cards.name: Silverstorm Samurai
cards.text:
Flash
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
cards.originalText:
You may play Silverstorm Samurai any time you could play an instant.
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Split-Tail Miko
cards.text: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: "I wish there were no use for those with my talents. I wish that I could walk Kamigawa forgotten and unneeded, with no war wounds to heal and no broken bones to mend."
cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.

cards.name: Takeno's Cavalry
cards.text:
Bushido 1 (Whenever this creature blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Takeno's Cavalry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking Spirit.
cards.flavor: At night he perfected his aim, shooting spiderwebs by starlight.
cards.originalText:
Bushido 1 (When this blocks or becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Takeno's Cavalry deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking Spirit.

cards.name: Tallowisp
cards.text: Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may search your library for an Aura card with enchant creature, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Isolated on its little candlewick, the kami never heard of the crime that drove its comrades to war.
cards.originalText: Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may search your library for an enchant creature card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

cards.name: Terashi's Grasp
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"The jeweler, the potter, the smith . . . They all imbue a bit of their souls into their creations. The kami destroy that crafted mortal shell and absorb the soul within."
—Noboru, master kitemaker
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.

cards.name: Terashi's Verdict
cards.text: Destroy target attacking creature with power 3 or less.
cards.flavor: It was as though the sky opened its eyes and found what it saw displeasing.
cards.originalText: Destroy target attacking creature with power 3 or less.

cards.name: Ward of Piety
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature this turn is dealt to any target instead.
cards.flavor: Reluctant to strike at the kami directly, some kitsune trained in more passive fighting techniques.

rulings.text: Redirected damage retains its information. For example, your opponent attacks you with Slith Firewalker (which reads, in part, "Whenever Slith Firewalker deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.") and you block with a creature enchanted with Ward of Piety. If you activate Ward of Piety, targeting your opponent, the Slith's ability triggers during the combat damage step and it gets a +1/+1 counter. It's still combat damage.

cards.originalText: {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to enchanted creature this turn is dealt to target creature or player instead.

cards.name: Waxmane Baku
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Waxmane Baku.
{1}, Remove X ki counters from Waxmane Baku: Tap X target creatures.
cards.originalText:
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Waxmane Baku.
{1}, Remove X ki counters from Waxmane Baku: Tap X target creatures.

cards.name: Yomiji, Who Bars the Way
cards.text: Whenever a legendary permanent other than Yomiji, Who Bars the Way is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return that card to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"As I died, I rejoiced. I would see my family again. But then I woke up back on the battlefield. Back in Kamigawa. Back in hell."
—Kenzo the Hardhearted

rulings.text: Yomiji's ability triggers whenever any legendary permanent is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, not just legendary creatures.
Yomiji's ability triggers even if Yomiji is going to the graveyard at the same time as the other legendary permanent.

foreignNames.name: Yomiji, celui qui clôt la voie
Yomiji, O que Barra o Caminho
Yomiji, el que impide el paso

cards.originalText: Whenever a legendary permanent other than Yomiji, Who Bars the Way is put into a graveyard from play, return that card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Callow Jushi
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Callow Jushi.
At the beginning of the end step, if there are two or more ki counters on Callow Jushi, you may flip it.
cards.originalText:
Whenever you play a Spirit or Arcane spell, you may put a ki counter on Callow Jushi.
At end of turn, if there are two or more ki counters on Callow Jushi, you may flip it.

cards.name: Disrupting Shoal
cards.text:
You may exile a blue card with converted mana cost X from your hand rather than pay this spell's mana cost.
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is X.

rulings.text: Disrupting Shoal can target any spell, but does nothing unless that spell's converted mana cost is X.

cards.originalText:
You may remove a blue card with converted mana cost X in your hand from the game rather than pay Disrupting Shoal's mana cost.
Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is X.

cards.name: Floodbringer
cards.text:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Tap target land.
cards.flavor: "Such a small thing, a drop of water . . . And yet enough of them together can flood a field, cleanse a mire, or choke a forest."

rulings.text: The land Floodbringer returns to its owner's hand can be the targeted land.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}, Return a land you control to its owner's hand: Tap target land.

cards.name: Genju of the Falls
cards.text:
Enchant Island
{2}: Enchanted Island becomes a 3/2 blue Spirit creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Island is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Falls from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature can attack, and its {T} abilities can be activated, only if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of their most recent turn. It doesn't matter how long the permanent has been a creature.

Activating the ability that turns it into a creature while it's already a creature will override any effects that set its power and/or toughness to a specific number. However, any effect that raises or lowers power and/or toughness (such as the effect created by Giant Growth, Glorious Anthem, or a +1/+1 counter) will continue to apply.

cards.originalText:
{2}: Enchanted Island becomes a 3/2 blue Spirit creature with flying until end of turn. It's still a land.
When enchanted Island is put into a graveyard, you may return Genju of the Falls from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Heed the Mists
cards.text: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard, then draw cards equal to that card's converted mana cost.
cards.flavor: "Once, I looked to the mists for wisdom. Now I wish only for understanding."
cards.originalText: Put the top card of your library into your graveyard, then draw cards equal to that card's converted mana cost.

cards.name: Higure, the Still Wind
cards.text:
Ninjutsu {2}{U}{U} ({2}{U}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Higure, the Still Wind deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a Ninja card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}: Target Ninja creature can't be blocked this turn.

rulings.text: If Higure deals regular combat damage and you use its ability to search for another Ninja, that card won't be in your hand in time to activate its ninjutsu ability to put it onto the battlefield and deal damage. However, the card you searched for could still be swapped for an unblocked creature, including Higure, as long as you activate its ninjutsu ability before the end of combat.

If Higure deals first strike damage (or the first part of double strike damage), the triggered ability would resolve before regular combat damage, and the searched-for Ninja would be able to get swapped with an unblocked creature and still deal its regular damage.

cards.originalText:
Ninjutsu {2}{U}{U} ({2}{U}{U}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card into play from your hand tapped and attacking.)
Whenever Higure deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a Ninja card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.
{2}: Target Ninja is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Jetting Glasskite
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time each turn, counter that spell or ability.
cards.flavor: The bolt struck with a flash and there was a terrible sound, as of glass shattering, but the creature was unharmed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Jetting Glasskite becomes the target of a spell or ability for the first time in a turn, counter that spell or ability.

cards.name: Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor: When it's finished, all that's left of you is a ripple on a still pond.
cards.originalText:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Whenever Kaijin of the Vanishing Touch blocks a creature, return that creature to its owner's hand at end of combat. (Return it only if it's in play.)

cards.flavor: Each spell is an intricate tapestry, and Kira is the great unraveler.
